meanings.definition: The territory or domain of a duke.
meanings.sent1: The duchy was a large area of land owned by the duke.
meanings.sent2: The duchy was known for its beautiful castles and vast forests.
meanings.sent3: The duchy had a special rule that all residents had to wear hats on Tuesdays.
meanings.sent4: In the duchy of dreams, the rivers flowed with imagination and the mountains echoed with creativity.
meanings.sent5: Visiting the duchy felt like stepping into a fairy tale with its enchanting landscapes.

meanings.definition: The rank or title of a duke.
meanings.sent1: The duchy was bestowed upon him after years of loyal service.
meanings.sent2: She inherited the duchy from her father and became the new duchess.
meanings.sent3: The duchy's annual ball was the most anticipated event of the year.
meanings.sent4: His duchy was not just a title, but a symbol of honor and responsibility.
meanings.sent5: Wearing the duchy's emblem made him feel proud and noble.

meanings.definition: A country, territory, or domain ruled by a duke or duchess.
meanings.sent1: The duchy prospered under the wise rule of the duke.
meanings.sent2: Travelers marveled at the beauty of the duchy's landscapes and architecture.
meanings.sent3: In the duchy, even the birds sang songs of loyalty to their ruler.
meanings.sent4: The duchy stood as a beacon of unity and strength in the region.
meanings.sent5: Living in the duchy felt like being part of a big, caring family.
